data.title: 1983 Chinese Zodiac
data.meta_description: Individuals born in 1983 fall under the Chinese zodiac sign of the Pig (or Boar). The lunar new year in 1983 began on February 13th, marking the start of the Water Pig year, which lasted until…
data.text:
Individuals born in 1983 fall under the Chinese zodiac sign of the Pig (or Boar). The lunar new year in 1983 began on February 13th, marking the start of the Water Pig year, which lasted until February 1, 1984. If you are born in 1983 before February 13th, you would fall under the Chinese zodiac sign of the Dog.

For a limited time, you can receive a free copy of ‘The Astrologer’s Guide: Mastering Birth Chart Interpretation’ by subscribing to our newsletter. Get your free book here: https://hermesastrology.substack.com/p/your-free-book.

Qualities and Traits of the Water Pig:

Kind and Compassionate: Kindness and compassion are key traits of the Water Pig. Individuals born in this year often possess a warm and caring nature, making them considerate and empathetic friends.

Optimistic and Easygoing: Optimism and an easygoing nature characterize the Water Pig’s personality. They approach life with a positive outlook, navigating challenges with a laid-back and adaptable demeanor.

Generous and Hospitable: Generosity and hospitality are hallmarks of the Water Pig. They enjoy sharing with others and often go out of their way to make those around them feel welcome and appreciated.

Diplomatic and Tactful: Diplomacy and tactfulness are strong qualities of the Water Pig. They navigate social situations with grace and are skilled in fostering harmonious connections.

Adaptable and Open-Minded: Adaptability and open-mindedness are traits of the Water Pig. They can adjust to different situations with ease, embracing change and approaching new experiences with curiosity.

Resilient and Persistent: Resilience and persistence characterize the Water Pig’s approach to challenges. They face setbacks with determination, demonstrating a strong commitment to overcoming obstacles.

Learn More about Hermes Astrology Professional Readings

Compatibility:

Friendly Signs:

Rabbit (1963, 1975, 1987, 1999, 2011): The Rabbit’s gentleness aligns well with the Pig’s compassionate disposition. Together, they can form a supportive and harmonious connection.

Sheep/Goat (1967, 1979, 1991, 2003, 2015): The Goat appreciates the Pig’s generosity and open-mindedness. Their shared values create a foundation for a positive and vibrant connection.

Tiger (1950, 1962, 1974, 1986, 1998): The Tiger’s boldness may be complemented by the Pig’s diplomatic and easygoing nature. Their collaborative efforts can result in a balanced and harmonious partnership.

Enemy Signs:

Snake (1965, 1977, 1989, 2001, 2013): The Snake’s strategic thinking may clash with the Pig’s more easygoing and adaptable demeanor. Navigating differences in approach requires open communication and understanding.

Monkey (1956, 1968, 1980, 1992, 2004): The Monkey’s cleverness may be at odds with the Pig’s more easygoing and optimistic personality. Balancing these differences requires compromise and mutual understanding.

Snake (1965, 1977, 1989, 2001, 2013): While the Snake is a friendly sign, potential conflicts may arise due to differences in approach and style. Patience and understanding are key in overcoming these challenges.
